unnormalised: Social Media & Influencer Marketing: Virality Trends
normalised: Social Media and Influencer Marketing: Virality Trends

unnormalised: Kya chal raha hai on the internet, bhaiyon aur beheno? Let's talk virality! This week, we've seen some crazy trends blowing up. From reel challenges set to the tunes of old Bollywood classics to quirky takes on everyday life in Mumbai, India is serving up some serious content fire.
normalised: Kya chal raha hai on the internet, bhaiyon aur beheno? Let's talk virality! This week, we've seen some crazy trends blowing up. From reel challenges set to the tunes of old Bollywood classics to quirky takes on everyday life in Mumbai, India is serving up some serious content fire.

unnormalised: Remember that 'DDLJ train scene' parody everyone was doing? That's classic virality! And who can forget "Rasode mein kaun tha?" which is still referenced today.
normalised: Remember that 'D D L J train scene' parody everyone was doing? That's classic virality! And who can forget "Rasode mein kaun tha?" which is still referenced today.

unnormalised: Experts at IIT-Delhi are analyzing these trends, trying to crack the code of what makes content go 'boom' online. They're saying authenticity and relatability are key. Forget perfect aesthetics; it's about genuine connection.
normalised: Experts at I I T hyphen Delhi are analyzing these trends, trying to crack the code of what makes content go 'boom' online. They're saying authenticity and relatability are key. Forget perfect aesthetics; it's about genuine connection.

unnormalised: Another trend? Short-form videos highlighting local businesses and hidden gems. People are loving discovering that amazing dosa place around the corner, all thanks to a 30-second clip.
normalised: Another trend? Short-form videos highlighting local businesses and hidden gems. People are loving discovering that amazing dosa place around the corner, all thanks to a thirty second clip.

unnormalised: The algorithms are ever-changing, but one thing remains constant: if it resonates with the Indian audience, it's got a shot at going viral. Keep creating, keep sharing, and who knows, you might just be the next big thing!
normalised: The algorithms are ever-changing, but one thing remains constant: if it resonates with the Indian audience, it's got a shot at going viral. Keep creating, keep sharing, and who knows, you might just be the next big thing!
